spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DYN_SOFT_RESET_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_SOFT_RSTB
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is a Soft Reset. 0- Puts the Controller into reset 1- Takes the Controller out of Reset Controller should be taken out of reset only when all other registers have been programmed. Asserting this bit does NOT reset all the APB configuration registers, once the soft reset bit is asserted the APB register should be modified as required.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESET_APB_REG
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full Soft Reset If this bit set when the soft reset bit is written as '1' then all APB registers reset to the power up state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: AXIRESET
spirit:field.spirit:description: It will set when main AXI reset signal is asserted. Reads and Writes to the Dynamic registers should not be carried out. This is Read only bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Reset Register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_RESERVED0
spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Reserved Register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DYN_REFRESH_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_REFRESH_TO_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Speculative refresh

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_SELFREF_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: If 1, then the controller puts the DRAM into self refresh when the transaction store is empty.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_REFRESH_UPDATE_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Toggle this signal to indicate that the refresh register(s) have been updated. The value is automatically updated when existing soft reset. So it does not need to be toggled initially.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RFC_MIN
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRFC (min) - Minimum time from refresh to refresh or activate (spec: 75ns to 195ns). Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Refresh Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DYN_REFRESH_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_REFRESH_BURST
spirit:field.spirit:description: The programmed value plus one is the number of refresh timeouts that is allowed to accumulate before traffic is blocked and the refreshes are forced to execute. Closing pages to perform a refresh is a one-time penalty that must be paid for each group of refreshes; therefore, performing refreshes in a burst reduces the per-refresh penalty of these page closings. Higher numbers for burst_of_N_refresh slightly increases utilization; lower numbers decreases the worst-case latency associated with refreshes. 0x0: Single refresh 0x1: Burst-of-2 0x7: Burst-of-8 refresh.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RFC_NOM_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: tREFI - Average time between refreshes (specifications: 7.8us). Unit: in multiples of 32 clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Refresh Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DYN_POWERDOWN_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DEEPPOWERDOWN_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 - Controller puts the DRAM into Deep Power down mode when the transaction store is empty. 0 - Brings Controller out of Deep Power down mode Present only in designs that has Mobile support. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_POWERDOWN_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: If true then the controller goes into power down after a programmable number of cycles (REG_DDRC_POWERDOWN_TO_X32). This register bit may be reprogrammed during the course of normal operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Power Down Control Register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DYN_DEBUG_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_DQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, DDRC will not de-queue any transactions from the CAM. Bypass will also be disabled. All transactions are queued in the CAM. This is for debug only; no reads or writes are issued to DRAM as long as this is asserted. This bit is intended to be switched on-the-fly. FOR DEBUG ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC debug register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_MODE_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DATA_BUS_WIDTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: 00: Full DQ bus width to DRAM. 01: Half DQ bus width to DRAM. 10: Quarter DQ bus width to DRAM. 11: Reserved. Note that the Half bus width modes are only supported when the DRAM bus width is a multiple of 16.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ECC_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: DRAM ECC Mode 000 - No ECC 101 - ECC Enabled All other selections are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_TEST_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 - Controller is in Test Mode 0 - Controller is in Normal Mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_SDRAM
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1- SDRAM mode 0 - Non-SDRAM mode Only present in designs that support SDRAM and/or mSDR device(s)

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_MOBILE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1: mobile/LPDDR DRAM device in use 0: non-mobile DRAM device in use

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DDR3
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1: DDR3 operating mode 0: DDR2 operating mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Mode Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ADDR_MAP_BANK_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_BANK_B2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bits used as bank address bit 2. Valid Range: 0 to 14 and 15 Internal Base: 4 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, bank address bit 2 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_BANK_B1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bits used as bank address bit 1. Valid Range: 0 to 14 Internal Base: 3 The selected address bit for each of the bank address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_BANK_B0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bits used as bank address bit 0. Valid Range: 0 to 14 Internal Base: 2 The selected address bit for each of the bank address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Bank Address Map Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ECC_DATA_MASK_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: CO_WU_RXDATA_MASK_INT_ECC
spirit:field.spirit:description: Mask to be used during production test. Valid when CO_WU_RXDATA_VALID is 1 Present only in designs that support ECC Test_mode: The value on this bus is driven on the ECC mask bits going to the DRAM bus Internal ECC mode (if supported): Unused

spirit:field.spirit:name: CO_WU_RXDATA_INT_ECC
spirit:field.spirit:description: Internal ECC / Production test data. Valid when co_wu_rxdata_valid is 1 Present only in designs that support ECC Test_mode: The data on this bus is driven on the ECC bits going to the DRAM bus Internal ECC mode (if supported): This contains the SECDED ECC associated with the CO_WU_RXDATA bus. Data on this bus is presented to the Internal ECC decode logic. If both test_mode and Internal_ECC are ON, then test_mode takes preference over Internal ECC.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ECC Test Data Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ADDR_MAP_COL_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B7
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 8. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 9. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 11. Valid Range: 0 to 7, and 15 Internal Base: 7 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, column address bit 9 is set to 0. Note: Per JEDEC DDR2 specific, column address bit 10 is reserved for indicating auto-precharge, and hence no source address bit can be mapped to column address bit 10.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B4
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bits used as column address bits 5. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bits used as column address bits 6. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bits 7. Valid Range: 0 to 7 Internal Base: 4 The selected address bit for each of the column address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B3
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 4. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 5. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 6. Valid Range: 0 to 7 Internal Base: 3 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 3. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 4. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 5. Valid Range: 0 to 7 Internal Base: 2 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Column Address Map Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ADDR_MAP_COL_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B11
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 13. Half bus width mode: Unused. To make it unused, this should be tied to 0xF Quarter bus width mode: Unused. To make it unused, this should be tied to 0xF Valid Range: 0 to 7, and 15 Internal Base: 11 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, column address bit 11 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B10
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bits used as column address bits 12. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bits used as column address bits 13. Quarter bus width mode: Unused. Should be set to 15. Valid Range: 0 to 7, and 15 Internal Base: 10 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, column address bit 10 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B9
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 11. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 12. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 13. Valid Range: 0 to 7, and 15 Internal Base: 9 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, column address bit 9 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B8
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 9. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 11. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 12. Valid Range: 0 to 7, and 15 Internal Base: 8 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, column address bit 9 is set to 0. Note: Per JEDEC DDR2 specific, column address bit 10 is reserved for indicating auto-precharge, and hence no source address bit can be mapped to column address bit 10.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Column Address Map Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ADDR_MAP_COL_3_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_SCRUB
spirit:field.spirit:description: This feature is not supported. Only default value works. 1 - Disable ECC scrubs 0 - Enable ECC scrubs Valid only when REG_DDRC_ECC_MODE = 100 or 101. Only present in designs that support ECC.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_COLLISION_PAGE_OPT
spirit:field.spirit:description: When this is set to '0', auto-precharge is disabled for the flushed command in a collision case. Collision cases are write followed by read to same address, read followed by write to same address, or write followed by write to same address with REG_DDRC_DIS_WC bit = 1 (where same address comparisons exclude the two address bits representing critical word).

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_PRE_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Only present in designs supporting precharge bypass. When 1, disable bypass path for high priority precharges

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_RD_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Only present in designs supporting read bypass. When 1, disable bypass path for high priority read page hits.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_ACT_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Only present in designs supporting activate bypass. When 1, disable bypass path for high priority read activates

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, disable Write Combine.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B6
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 7. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 8. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bits 9. Valid Range: 0 to 7 Internal Base: 6 The selected address bit for each of the column address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_COL_B5
spirit:field.spirit:description: Full bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 6. Half bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bit 7. Quarter bus width mode: Selects the address bit used as column address bits 8. Valid Range: 0 to 7 Internal Base: 5 The selected address bit for each of the column address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Upper byte is DDRC Column Address Map Register and lower byte control debug features

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ADDR_MAP_ROW_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_ROW_B12
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bit used as row address bit 12. Valid Range: 0 to 11, and 15 Internal Base: 18 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, row address bit 12 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_ROW_B2_11
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bits used as row address bits 2 to 11. Valid Range: 0 to 11 Internal Base: 8 for row address bit 2 9 for row address bit 3 10 for row address bit 4 ... 15 for row address bit 9 16 for row address bit 10 17 for row address bit 11 The selected address bit for each of the row address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_ROW_B1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bits used as row address bit 1. Valid Range: 0 to 11 Internal Base: 7 The selected address bit for each of the row address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_ROW_B0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bits used as row address bit 0. Valid Range: 0 to 11 Internal Base: 6 The selected address bit for each of the row address bits is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Row Address Map Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ADDR_MAP_ROW_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_ROW_B15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bit used as row address bit 15. Valid Range: 0 to 11, and 15 Internal Base: 21 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, row address bit 15 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_ROW_B14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bit used as row address bit 14. Valid Range: 0 to 11, and 15 Internal Base: 20 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, row address bit 14 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_ADDRMAP_ROW_B13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the address bits used as row address bit 13. Valid Range: 0 to 11, and 15 Internal Base: 19 The selected address bit is determined by adding the Internal Base to the value of this field. If set to 15, row address bit 13 is set to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Row Address Map Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_INIT_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_SKIP_OCD
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register must be kept at 1. 1 - Indicates the controller to skip OCD adjustment step during DDR2 initialization. OCD_Default and OCD_Exit are performed instead. 0 - Not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_FINAL_WAIT_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Cycles to wait after completing the DRAM initialization sequence before starting the dynamic scheduler. Units are in counts of a global timer that pulses every 32 clock cycles. There is known specific requirement for this; it may be set to zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_PRE_OCD_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Wait period before driving the OCD Complete command to DRAM. Units are in counts of a global timer that pulses every 32 clock cycles. There is no known specific requirement for this. It may be set to zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Initialization Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_CKE_RSTN_CYCLES_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DRAM_RSTN_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of cycles to assert DRAM reset signal during init sequence. This is only present for implementations supporting DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_PRE_CKE_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 8 bits of REG_DDRC_PRE_CKE_X1024 Cycles to wait after reset before driving CKE high to start the DRAM initialization sequence. Units: 1024 clock cycles. DDR2 Specifications typically require this to be programmed for a delay of >= 200 us.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Initialization Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_CKE_RSTN_CYCLES_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_PRE_CKE_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Upper 2 bits of REG_DDRC_PRE_CKE_X1024 Cycles to wait after reset before driving CKE high to start the DRAM initialization sequence. Units: 1024 clock cycles. DDR2 Specifications typically require this to be programmed for a delay of >= 200 us.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_POST_CKE_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Cycles to wait after driving CKE high to start the DRAM initialization sequence. Units: 1024 clocks. DDR - Typically require a 400 ns delay, requiring this value to be programmed to 2 at all clock speeds. SDR - Typically require this to be programmed for a delay of 100us to 200us.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Initialization Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_INIT_MR_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_MR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Value to be loaded into the DRAM Mode register. Bit 8 is for DLL and the setting here is ignored. The controller sets appropriately.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC MR Initialization Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_INIT_EMR_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_EMR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Value to be loaded into DRAM EMR registers. Bits [9:7] are for OCD and the setting in this register is ignored. The controller sets those bits appropriately.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC EMR Initialization Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_INIT_EMR2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_EMR2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Value to be loaded into DRAM EMR2 registers.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC EMR2 Initialization Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_INIT_EMR3_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_EMR3
spirit:field.spirit:description: Value to be loaded into DRAM EMR3 registers.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC EMR3 Initialization Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_BANK_TIMING_PARAM_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_FAW
spirit:field.spirit:description: tFAW - Valid only in burst of 8 mode. At most 4 banks must be activated in a rolling window of tFAW cycles. Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RC
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRC - Minimum time between activates to same bank (spec: 65 ns for DDR2-400 and smaller for faster parts). Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM Bank Timing Parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_RD_WR_LATENCY_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_READ_LATENCY
spirit:field.spirit:description: Time from read command to read data on DRAM interface. Unit: clocks. This signal is present for designs supporting LPDDR/LPDDR2 DRAM only. It is used to calculate when DRAM clock may be stopped.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_WRITE_LATENCY
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of clocks between the Write Command to Write Data Enable PHY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM Write Latency Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_RD_WR_PRE_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RD2PRE
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRTP - Minimum time from read to precharge of same bank (spec: tRTP for BL=4 and tRTP+2 for BL=8. tRTP = 7.5 ns). Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_WR2PRE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Min time between write and precharge to same bank (specifications: WL + BL/2 + tWR = approximately 8 cycles + 15 ns = 14 clocks @400MHz and less for lower frequencies). Unit: Clocks where: WL = write latency. BL = burst length. This must match the value programmed in the BL bit of the mode register to the DRAM. tWR = write recovery time. This comes directly from the DRAM specs.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM Read-Write precharge Timing Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_MR_TIMING_PARAM_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_MRD
spirit:field.spirit:description: tMRD - Cycles between Load Mode commands. Not used in DDR3 mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_MOD
spirit:field.spirit:description: Present for DDR3 only (replaces REG_DDRC_T_MRD functionality when used with DDR3 devices). Mode register set command update delay in number of clock cycles. This is required to be programmed even when a design that supports DDR3 is running in ddr2 mode. (Minimum is the largest of 12 clock cycles or 15ns).

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM Mode Register Timing Parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_RAS_TIMING_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RAS_MIN
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRAS(min) - Minimum time between activate and precharge to the same bank(spec: 45 ns). Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RAS_MAX
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRAS(max) - Maximum time between activate and precharge to same bank. Maximum time that a page can be kept open (spec: 70 us). Minimum value of this register is 1. Zero is invalid. Unit: Multiples of 1024 clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM RAS Timing Parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_RD_WR_TRNARND_TIME_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_WR2RD
spirit:field.spirit:description: WL + tWTR + BL/2 Minimum time from WRITE command to READ command. Includes time for bus turnaround and recovery times and all per-bank, per- rank, and global constraints. Unit: clocks. Where: WL = write latency. BL = burst length. This should match the value programmed in the BL bit of the mode register to the DRAM. tWTR = internal WRITE to READ command delay. This comes directly from the DRAM specs.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RD2WR
spirit:field.spirit:description: RL + BL/2 + 2 - WL Min time from READ command to WRITE command. Include time for bus turnaround and all per-bank, per-rank, and global constraints. Unit: clocks. Where: WL = write latency. BL = burst length. This must match the value programmed in the BL bit of the mode register to the DRAM. RL = read latency = CAS latency.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM Read Write Turn-around Timing Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_T_PD_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_CKE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minimum number of cycles of CKE HIGH/LOW during power down and self refresh. Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_XP
spirit:field.spirit:description: tXP: Minimum time after power down exit to any operation. Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM Power Down Parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DRAM_BANK_ACT_TIMING_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RP
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRP - Minimum time from precharge to activate of same bank. Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RRD
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRRD - Minimum time between activates from bank A to bank B (specifications: 10ns or less). Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_CCD
spirit:field.spirit:description: tCCD - Minimum time between two reads or two writes (from bank A to bank B) (spec: 2 cycles) is this value + 1. Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_RCD
spirit:field.spirit:description: tRCD - Minimum time from activate to READ or WRITE command to same bank (spec: 15ns for DDR2-400 and lower for faster devices). Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DRAM Bank Activate Timing Parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ODT_PARAM_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RANK0_RD_ODT
spirit:field.spirit:description: [NUM_RANKS-1:0] -Indicates which remote odt's should be turned on during a Read to Rank 0. Each rank has a remote ODT (in the DRAM) which can be turned on by setting the appropriate bit here. Rank 0 is controlled by the LSB, Rank 1 is controlled by bit next to the LSB, etc. For each rank, set its bit to 1 to enable its ODT. [NUM_RANKS] - Uppermost bit is UNUSED

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RANK0_WR_ODT
spirit:field.spirit:description: [NUM_RANKS-1:0] -Indicates which remote odt's should be turned on during a Write to Rank 0. Each rank has a remote ODT (in the DRAM) which can be turned on by setting the appropriate bit here. Rank 0 is controlled by the LSB, Rank 1 is controlled by bit next to the LSB, etc. For each rank, set its bit to 1 to enable its ODT. [NUM_RANKS] - Uppermost bit is UNUSED

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_WR_ODT_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: The delay, in clock cycles, from issuing a WRITE command to setting ODT values associated with that command. The Recommended value for DDR2 is CL - 5. where CL is CAS latency. DDR ODT has a 2-cycle on-time delay and a 2.5-cycle off-time delay. ODT setting should remain constant for the entire time that DQS is driven by the controller.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RD_ODT_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: The delay, in clock cycles, from issuing a READ command to setting ODT values associated with that command. Recommended value for DDR2 is CL - 4.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ODT Delay Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ODT_PARAM_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_WR_ODT_BLOCK
spirit:field.spirit:description: 00 - block read/write scheduling for 1-cycle when Write requires changing ODT settings. 01 - block read/write scheduling for 2 cycles when Write requires changing ODT settings. 10 - block read/write scheduling for 3 cycles when Write requires changing ODT settings. 11 - Reserved.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_WR_ODT_HOLD
spirit:field.spirit:description: Cycles to hold ODT for a WRITE Command. When 0, ODT signal is ON for 1 cycle. When 1, ODT signal is ON for 2 cycles, and so on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RD_ODT_HOLD
spirit:field.spirit:description: Cycles to hold ODT for a READ Command. When 0, ODT signal is ON for 1 cycle. When 1, ODT signal is ON for 2 cycles, and so on.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ODT Hold/Block cycles Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DEBUG_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_SCRUB
spirit:field.spirit:description: This feature is not supported. Only default value works. 1 - Disable ECC scrubs 0 - Enable ECC scrubs Valid only when REG_DDRC_ECC_MODE = 100 or 101. Only present in designs that support ECC.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_COLLISION_PAGE_OPT
spirit:field.spirit:description: When this is set to '0', auto-precharge is disabled for the flushed command in a collision case. Collision cases are write followed by read to same address, read followed by write to same address, or write followed by write to same address with REG_DDRC_DIS_WC bit = 1 (where same address comparisons exclude the two address bits representing critical word).

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_PRE_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Only present in designs supporting precharge bypass. When 1, disable bypass path for high priority precharges

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_RD_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Only present in designs supporting read bypass. When 1, disable bypass path for high priority read page hits.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_ACT_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Only present in designs supporting activate bypass. When 1, disable bypass path for high priority read activates

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, disable Write Combine.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Debug Register and DDRC Column Address Map Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_MODE_REG_RD_WR_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_MR_TYPE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates whether the Mode register operation is read or write 1 - Read 0 - Write.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_MR_ADDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Address of the Mode register that is to be written to. 00- MR0 01- MR1 10- MR2 11- MR3

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_MR_WR
spirit:field.spirit:description: When written to a '1' and DDRC_REG_MR_WR_BUSY is low then a mode register read or write operation is started. There is no need to the CPU to set this back to zero. This bit always reads as zero. Controller accepts this command, if this signal is detected high and DDRC_REG_MR_WR_BUSY is detected low.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Mode Register Read/Write Command Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_MODE_REG_DATA_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_MR_DATA
spirit:field.spirit:description: Mode register write data.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Mode Register Write Data Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_PWR_SAVE_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_CLOCK_STOP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1- Stops the clock to the PHY whenever a clock is not required by LPDDR. 0-Clock will never be stopped. This is only present for implementations supporting mobile/LPDDR devices

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_POWERDOWN_TO_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: After this many clocks of NOP or DESELECT the controller puts the DRAM into power down. This must be enabled in the Master Control Register. Unit: Multiples of 32 clocks FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_POST_SELFREF_GAP_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minimum time to wait after coming out of self refresh before doing anything. This must be bigger than all the constraints that exist (specifications: max of tXSNR and tXSRD and tXSDLL which is 512 clocks). Unit: in multiples of 32 clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Power Save Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_PWR_SAVE_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_PAD_PD
spirit:field.spirit:description: If pads have a power-saving mode, this is the greater of the time for the pads to enter power down or the time for the pads to exit power down. Used only in non-DFI designs. Unit: clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DEEPPOWERDOWN_TO_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minimum deep power down time applicable only for LPDDR2. LPDDR exits from deep power down mode immediately after REG_DDRC_DEEPPOWERDOWN_EN is deasserted. For LPDDR2, Value from the spec is 500us. Units are in 1024 clock cycles. Present only in designs that has Mobile support. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DIS_PAD_PD
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1- disable the pad power down feature. 0- Enable the pad power down feature. Used only in non-DFI designs.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Power Save Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ZQ_LONG_TIME_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_ZQ_LONG_NOP
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of cycles of NOP required after a ZQCL (ZQ calibration long) command is issued to DRAM. Unit: Clock cycles. This is only present for implementations supporting DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ZQ Long Time Calibration Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ZQ_SHORT_TIME_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_ZQ_SHORT_NOP
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of cycles of NOP required after a ZQCS (ZQ calibration short) command is issued to DRAM. Unit: Clock cycles. This is only present for implementations supporting DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ZQ Short Time Calibration Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ZQ_SHORT_INT_REFRESH_MARGIN_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_REFRESH_MARGIN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Threshold value in number of clock cycles before the critical refresh or page timer expires. A critical refresh is to be issued before this threshold is reached. Recommended to use default value. Unit: multiples of 32 clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_ZQ_SHORT_INTERVAL_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 12 bits of REG_DDRC_T_ZQ_SHORT_INTERVAL_X1024. Average interval to wait between automatically issuing ZQCS (ZQ calibration short) commands to DDR3 devices. Not considered if REG_DDRC_DIS_AUTO_ZQ=1. Unit: 1024 Clock cycles This is only present for implementations supporting DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ZQ Short Time Calibration Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_ZQ_SHORT_INT_REFRESH_MARGIN_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_T_ZQ_SHORT_INTERVAL_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Upper 8 bits of REG_DDRC_T_ZQ_SHORT_INTERVAL_X1024 Average interval to wait between automatically issuing ZQCS (ZQ calibration short) commands to DDR3 devices. Not considered if REG_DDRC_DIS_AUTO_ZQ=1. Units: 1024 Clock cycles This is only present for implementations supporting DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ZQ Short Time Calibration Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_PERF_PARAM_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_LPR_NUM_ENTRIES
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of entries in the low priority transaction store is this value plus 1. (READ_CAM_DEPTH - (REG_DDRC_LPR_NUM_ENTRIES + 1)) is the number of entries available for the high priority transaction store. READ_CAM_DEPTH = Depth of the read transaction store Setting this to maximum value allocates all entries to Low Priority transaction store. Setting this to 0 allocates 1 entry to low priority transaction store and the rest to high priority transaction store. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit must always be set to zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_PAGECLOSE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1-bank is closed and kept closed if no transactions are available for it. This is different from auto-precharge in that (a) explicit precharge commands are used, and not read/write with auto-precharge and (b) page is not closed after a read/write if there is another read/write pending to the same page. 0-bank remains open until there is a need to close it (to open a different page, or for page timeout or refresh timeout.) This does not apply when auto-refresh is used. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RDWR_IDLE_GAP
spirit:field.spirit:description: When the preferred transaction store is empty for these many clock cycles, switch to the alternate transaction store if it is non-empty. The read transaction store (both high and low priority) is the default preferred transaction store and the write transaction store is the alternate store. When "Prefer write over read" is set this is reversed. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_2
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit must always be set to zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_BURST_RDWR
spirit:field.spirit:description: 001: Burst length of 4 010: Burst length of 8 100: Burst length of 16 All other values are reserved. This controls the burst size used to access the DRAM. This must match the BL mode register setting in the DRAM. Note: 1. The DDRC and AXI controllers are optimized for a burst length of 8. 2. The recommended setting is 8. 3. Burst length of 16 is only supported for LPDDR1. Setting to 16 when using LPDDR in Half/Quarter bus mode may boost performance. 4. For systems that tend to do lots of single cycle random transactions a burst length of 4 may slightly improve system performance.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_3
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_HPR_QUEUE_PARAM_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_HPR_XACT_RUN_LENGTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of transactions that are serviced once the HPR queue goes critical is the smaller of: this value and Number of transactions available. Unit: Transaction FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_HPR_MIN_NON_CRITICAL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of clocks that the HPR queue is guaranteed to be non-critical. Unit: 32 clocks. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_HPR_MAX_STARVE_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 1 bit of REG_DDRC_HPR_MAX_STARVE_X32 Number of clocks that the HPR queue can be starved before it goes critical. Unit: 32 clocks. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_HPR_QUEUE_PARAM_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_HPR_MAX_STARVE_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Upper 11 bits of REG_DDRC_LPR_MAX_STARVE_X32 Number of clocks that the HPR queue can be starved before it goes critical. Unit: 32 clocks. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_LPR_QUEUE_PARAM_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_LPR_XACT_RUN_LENGTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of transactions that are serviced once the LPR queue goes critical is the smaller of: this value and Number of transactions available. Unit: Transaction. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_LPR_MIN_NON_CRITICAL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of clocks that the LPR queue is guaranteed to be non-critical. Unit: 32 clocks. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_LPR_MAX_STARVE_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 1 bit of REG_DDRC_LPR_MAX_STARVE_X32 Number of clocks that the LPR queue can be starved before it goes critical. Unit: 32 clocks. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_LPR_QUEUE_PARAM_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_LPR_MAX_STARVE_X32
spirit:field.spirit:description: Upper 11 bits of REG_DDRC_HPR_MAX_STARVE_X32 Number of clocks that the LPR queue can be starved before it goes critical. Unit: 32 clocks. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_WR_QUEUE_PARAM_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_W_XACT_RUN_LENGTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of transactions that are serviced once the WR queue goes critical is the smaller of: this value and Number of transactions available. Unit: Transaction. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_W_MIN_NON_CRITICAL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of clocks that the write queue is guaranteed to be non-critical. Unit: 32 clocks. FOR PERFORMANCE ONLY.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_PERF_PARAM_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_FORCE_LOW_PRI_N
spirit:field.spirit:description: Active Low signal. When asserted ('0'), all incoming transactions are forced to low priority. Forcing the incoming transactions to low priority implicitly turns off bypass.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_PREFER_WRITE
spirit:field.spirit:description: If set then the bank selector prefers writes over reads.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_GO2CRITICAL_HYSTERESIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Describes the number of cycles that CO_GS_GO2CRITICAL_RD or CO_GS_GO2CRITICAL_WR must be asserted before the corresponding queue moves to the critical state in the DDRC.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_BURST_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1: Interleaved Burst Mode 0: Sequential Burst Mode The burst mode programmed in the DRAM mode register and the order of the input data to the Controller should both match the value programmed in the REG_DDRC_BURST_MODE register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_BURSTCHOP
spirit:field.spirit:description: Not supported in this version of the DDRC controller always reads as zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_PERF_PARAM_3_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_EN_2T_TIMING_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1: DDRC uses 2T timing. 0: DDRC uses 1T timing.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_2T_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the clock edge in which chip select (CSN) and CKE is asserted. There are 9 CSN and CKE (one for every 4 DQS). Each bit of this signal controls the corresponding CSN & CKE. Bit[0] controls CSN0[1:0] and CKE0 Bit[1] controls CSN1[1:0] and CKE1 and so on. '0' on any bit indicates that the corresponding CSN and CKE will be asserted (set to 0) on the first cycle that address/command are driven to DRAM. '1' on any bit indicates that the corresponding CSN and CKE will be asserted (set to 0) on the second cycle that address/command are driven to DRAM.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Performance parameter Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_RDDATA_EN_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_T_RDDATA_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Time from the assertion of a READ command on the DFI interface to the assertion of the DDRC_DFI_RDDATA_EN signal. Program this to (RL - 1), where RL is the Read Latency of the DRAM. For LPDDR this should be set to RL. Units: Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Read Command Timing Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_MIN_CTRLUPD_TIMING_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_T_CTRLUP_MIN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Specifies the minimum number of clock cycles that the DDRC_DFI_CTRLUPD_REQ signal must be asserted. Lowest value to assign to this variable is 0x3. Units: Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Controller Update Min Time Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_MAX_CTRLUPD_TIMING_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_T_CTRLUP_MAX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Specifies the maximum number of clock cycles that the DDRC_DFI_CTRLUPD_REQ signal can assert. Lowest value to assign to this variable is 0x40. Units: Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Controller Update Max Time Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_WR_LVL_CONTROL_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_WRLVL_WW
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write leveling write-to-write delay. Specifies the minimum number of clock cycles from the assertion of a DDRC_DFI_WRLVL_STROBE signal to the next DDRC_DFI_WRLVL_STROBE signal. Only applicable when connecting to PHY's operating in PHY RdLvl Evaluation mode. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices. Units: Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_WRLVL_MAX_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 8 bits Write leveling maximum time. Specifies the maximum number of clock cycles that the controller will wait for a response (PHY_DFI_WRLVL_RESP) to a write leveling enable signal (DDRC_DFI_WRLVL_EN). Only applicable when connecting to PHY's operating in PHY WrLvl Evaluation mode. Units: 1024 Clocks Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Write Levelling Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_WR_LVL_CONTROL_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_WRLVL_MAX_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Upper 4 bits Write leveling maximum time. Specifies the maximum number of clock cycles that the controller will wait for a response (PHY_DFI_WRLVL_RESP) to a write leveling enable signal (DDRC_DFI_WRLVL_EN). Only applicable when connecting to PHY's operating in PHY WrLvl Evaluation mode. Units: 1024 Clocks Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_WR_LEVEL_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1-Write leveling mode has been enabled as part of init sequence. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_T_WLMRD
spirit:field.spirit:description: First DQS/DQS# rising edge after write leveling mode is programmed. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices. Units: Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Write Levelling Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_RD_LVL_CONTROL_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_RDLVL_RR
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1-Read Data Eye training mode has been enabled as part of init sequence. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_RDLVL_MAX_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 8 bits. Read leveling read-to-read delay. Specifies the minimum number of clock cycles from the assertion of a read command to the next read command. Only applicable when connecting to PHY's operating in PHY RdLvl Evaluation mode. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices. Units: Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Read Levelling Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_RD_LVL_CONTROL_2_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_RDLVL_MAX_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: Upper 4 bits. Read leveling read-to-read delay. Specifies the minimum number of clock cycles from the assertion of a read command to the next read command. Only applicable when connecting to PHY's operating in PHY RdLvl Evaluation mode. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices. Units: Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_RD_DQS_GATE_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Read leveling maximum time. Specifies the maximum number of clock cycles that the controller will wait for a response (PHY_DFI_RDLVL_RESP) to a read leveling enable signal (DDRC_DFI_RDLVL_EN or DDRC_DFI_RDLVL_GATE_EN). Only applicable when connecting to PHY's operating in PHY RdLvl Evaluation mode. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices. Units: 1024 Clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_RD_DATA_EYE_TRAIN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1-Read DQS Date Leveling mode has been enabled as part of init sequence. Only present in designs that support DDR3 devices.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Read Levelling Control Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DFI_CTRLUPD_TIME_INTERVAL_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_T_CTRLUPD_INTERVAL_MAX_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the maximum amount of time between Controller initiated DFI update requests. This timer resets with each update request; when the timer expires, traffic is blocked for a few cycles. PHY can use this idle time to recalibrate the delay lines to the DLLs. The DLL calibration is also used to reset PHY FIFO pointers in case of data capture errors. Updates are required to maintain calibration over PVT, but frequent updates may impact performance. Units: 1024 clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_DDRC_DFI_T_CTRLUPD_INTERVAL_MIN_X1024
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the minimum amount of time between controller initiated DFI update requests (which will be executed whenever the controller is idle). Set this number higher to reduce the frequency of update requests, which can have a small impact on the latency of the first read request when the controller is idle. Units: 1024 clocks

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC DFI Controller Update Time Interval Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DYN_SOFT_RESET_ALIAS_CR
spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Reset Register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_AXI_FABRIC_PRI_ID_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: PRIORITY_ID
spirit:field.spirit:description: If the Priority Enable bit is 1 then this ID will have a higher priority over other ID's.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PRIORITY_ENABLE_BIT
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is to set the priority of the Fabric Master ID. 01: Indicates that the ID is higher priority but still lower than the ICache and DSG bus. 10/11: Indicates that the ID has the highest priority even higher than ICache and DSG bus (to be used for isochronous traffic display applications only). This only affects the reads. Writes would still have the priority lower than Cache/DSG. 00 - None of the Master ID's from Fabric have a higher priority

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC AXI Interface Fabric Priority ID Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_SR

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_REG_MR_WR_BUSY
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 - Indicates that mode register write operation is in progress. 0 - Indicates that the core can initiate a mode register write operation. Core must initiate a MR write operation only if this signal is low. This signal goes high in the clock after the controller accepts the write request. It goes low when the MR write command is issued to the DRAM. Any MR write command that is received when 'DDRC_REG_MR_WR_BUSY' is high, is not accepted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_REG_TWRLVL_MAX_ERROR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Single pulse output: when '1' indicates the WRLVL_MAX timer has timed out.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_REG_TRDLVL_MAX_ERROR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Single pulse output: when '1' indicates the RDRLVL_MAX timer has timed out.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_CORE_REG_OPERATING_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Operating mode. This is 3-bits widein designs with Mobile support and 2-bits in all other designs Non-Mobile designs: 00 - Init 01 - Normal 10 - Power down 11 - Self Refresh Mobile designs: 000 - Init 001 - Normal 010 - Power down 011 - Self Refresh 1XX - Deep Power down

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Status Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_SINGLE_ERR_CNT_SR

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_SINGLE_ERR_CNT_STATUS_REG
spirit:field.spirit:description: Single Error Count Status If the count reaches 0xFFFF then it is held and only cleared after the DDRC_ECC_ERR_READ_DONE_CR is written over by the System

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC Single Error Count Status Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_DOUBLE_ERR_CNT_SR

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_DOUBLE_ERR_CNT_STATUS_REG
spirit:field.spirit:description: Double Error Count Status If the count reaches 0xFFFF then it is held and only cleared after the DDRC_ECC_ERR_READ_DONE_CR is written over by the System

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC double error count status register

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_LUE_SYNDROME_1_SR

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_REG_ECC_SYNDROMES
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 16 bits First data which has ECC error in it. 128-bits consists of the following Device Correction ECC: (if supported) [127:64] - ECC [ 63: 00] - Data SECDED ECC: [127:72] - Don't care [71:64] - ECC [63:00] - Data In the same clock cycle, if one lane has correctable error and the other lane has uncorrectable error, then the syndrome for the uncorrectable error is sent on this bus. If more than one data lane has error in it, then the lower data lane is selected. The priority applied when there are multiple errors in the same cycle is as follows: Uncorrectable error, lower lane Uncorrectable error, upper lane Correctable error, lower lane Correctable error, upper lane Only present in designs that support ECC. This is Cleared after the DDRC_ECC_ERR_READ_DONE_CR is written over by the System

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_LCB_BIT_NUM
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the location of the bit that caused single-bit error in SECDED ECC case (encoded value). If more than one data lane has error in it, the lower data lane is selected. This register is 7-bit wide in order to handle 72-bits of the data present in a single lane. This doesn't indicate corrected_bit_num in the case of Device Correction ECC. The encoding is only present in designs that support ECC.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDRC_LCB_MASK_1_SR

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDRC_LCB_MASK
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 16 bits. Indicates the mask of the corrected data. 1 - on any bit indicates that the bit has been corrected by the DRAM ECC logic 0 - on any bit indicates that the bit has NOT been corrected by the DRAM ECC logic. Valid when any bit of DDRC_REG_ECC_CORRECTED_ERR is high. This mask doesn't indicate any correction that has been made in the ECC check bits. If there are errors in multiple lanes, then this signal will have the mask for the lowest lane.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ECC_OUTPUT_DATA_SR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Internal ECC / Production test data. Valid when ra_co_resp_valid is high Only present in designs that support ECC Test mode: The production test pattern that was sent on the ECC bus (co_wu_rxdata_int_ecc) is returned to the core on this bus. Internal ECC: Contains the Internal ECC encoded data corresponding to ra_co_resp_data bus. If both test_mode and Internal_ECC are ON, then test_mode takes preference over Internal ECC.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: DDRC ECC Output Data - For Production test

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_DYN_BIST_TEST_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_BIST_FORCE_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register bit is used to check that BIST checker is not giving false pass. When this port is set 1, data bit gets inverted before sending out to the external memory and BIST checker must return a mismatch error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_BIST_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: The mode bits select the pattern type generated by the BIST generator. All the patterns are transmitted continuously once enabled. 00 : constant pattern (0 repeated on each DQ bit) 01 : low freq pattern (00001111 repeated on each DQ bit) 10 : PRBS pattern (2^7-1 PRBS pattern repeated on each DQ bit) Each DQ bit always has same data value except when early shifting in PRBS mode is requested.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_BIST_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable the internal BIST generation and checker logic when this port is set HIGH. Setting this port as '0' will stop the BIST Generator / checker. In order to run BIST tests, this port must be set along with reg_phy_loopback.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_AT_SPD_ATPG
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 = test with full clock speed but lower coverage. 0 = test with lower clock speed but higher coverage.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: PHY BIST test configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:description: Ratio value for address/command launches timing in phy_ctrl macro. This is the fraction of a clock cycle represented by the shift to be applied to the read DQS in units of 256ths. In other words, the full-cycle tap value from the master DLL will be scaled by this number over 256 to get the delay value for the slave delay line.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_DIS_CALIB_RST
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disable the resetting of the Read Capture FIFO pointers with dll_calib (internally generated signal). The pointers are reset to ensure that the PHY can recover if the appropriate number of DQS edges is not observed after a read command (which can happen when the DQS squelch timing is manually overridden via the debug registers). 0: enable, 1: disable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_DLL_LOCK_DIFF
spirit:field.spirit:description: The maximum number of delay line taps variation allowed while maintaining the master DLL lock. This is calculated as total jitter/ delay line tap size. Where total jitter is half of (incoming clock jitter (pp) + delay line jitter (pp)).

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_INVERT_CLKOUT_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_INVERT_CLKOUT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Inverts the polarity of DRAM clock. 0: core clock is passed on to DRAM. Most common usage mode. 1: inverted core clock is passed on to DRAM. Use this when CLK can arrive at a DRAM device ahead of DQS or coincidence with DQS based on boad topology. This effectively delays the CLK to the DRAM device by -cycle, providing a CLK edge that DQS can align to during leveling.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_WR_DATA_SLAVE_RATIO
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 16 bits. Ratio value for write data slave DLL. This is the fraction of a clock cycle represented by the shift to be applied to the write DQ muxes in units of 256ths. In other words, the full-cycle tap value from the master DLL will be scaled by this number over 256 to get the delay value for the slave delay line. This is only used when reg_phy_use_wr_level=0. X is the number of 8 bit memory Data Slices supported. R is the number of Ranks supported. Default value: 0x40

spirit:field.spirit:description: The user programmable init ratio selection mode. 1: selects a starting ratio value based on reg_phy_wrlvl_init_ratio port. 0: selects a starting ratio value based on Write Leveling of previous data slice.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_WRLVL_INIT_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 16 bits. The user programmable init ratio used by Write Leveling FSM when REG_PHY_WRLVL_INIT_MODE port is set to 1. X is the number of 8 bit memory Data Slices supported. R is the number of Ranks supported. The recommended setting of reg_phy_wrlvl_init_ratio is half cycle less than total skew between CLK & DQS at the DRAM.

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_WR_RD_RL_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_RD_RL_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: This delay determines when to select the active rank's ratio logic delay for FIFO_WE and Read DQS slave delay lines after PHY receives a read command at Control Interface This is only used for multi-rank designs when reg_phy_use_rank0_delays=0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_WR_RL_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: This delay determines when to select the active rank's ratio logic delay for Write Data and Write DQS slave delay lines after PHY receives a write command at Control Interface. This is only used for multi-rank designs when reg_phy_use_rank0_delays=0. This must be programmed as (Write Latency -4) with a minimum value of 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
