spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_RDC_FIFO_RST_ERR_CNT_CLR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Clear/reset for counter rdc_fifo_rst_err_cnt[3:0]. 0: no clear, 1: clear.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Reset register for counter

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_RDC_WE_TO_RE_DELAY_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_RDC_WE_TO_RE_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: Register input - specified in number of clock cycles This is valid only if use_fixed_re? is high. As Read Capture FIFO depth is limited to 8 entries only, the recommended value for this port is less than 8, even though a higher number may work in some cases depending upon memory system design.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Configurable register for delay between WE and RE

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_USE_FIXED_RE_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_USE_FIXED_RE
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1: PHY generates FIFO read enable after fixed number of clock cycles as defined by reg_phy_rdc_we_to_re_delay[3:0]. When 0: PHY uses the not_empty method to do the read enable generation. Note: This port must be set HIGH during training/leveling process i.e. when ddrc_dfi_wrlvl_en/ddrc_dfi_rdlvl_en/ddrc_dfi_rdlvl_gate_en port is set HIGH.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Selection register for generating read enable to FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_USE_RANK0_DELAYS_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_USE_RANK0_DELAYS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Delay selection. This applies to multi-rank designs only. 1- Rank 0 delays are used for all ranks 0- Each Rank uses its own delay This port must be set HIGH when write latency < 5.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Delay selection. This applies to multi-rank designs only.

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_USE_LVL_TRNG_LEVEL_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_USE_RD_DATA_EYE_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Read Data Eye training control. 0 : Use register programmed ratio values 1 : Use ratio for delay line calculated by data eye leveling Note: This port must be set 0 when PHY is not working in DDR3 mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_USE_RD_DQS_GATE_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Read DQS Gate training control. 0 : Use register programmed ratio values 1 : Use ratio for delay line calculated by DQS gate leveling This can be used in DDR2 mode also. Note: This port must be set 0 when PHY is not working in DDR2/DDR3 mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_USE_WR_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write Leveling training control. 0 : Use register programmed ratio values 1 : Use ratio for delay line calculated by write leveling Note: This port must be set 0 when PHY is not working in DDR3 mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: training control register

spirit:register.spirit:name: PHY_DYN_CONFIG_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_CMD_LATENCY
spirit:field.spirit:description: Extra Command Latency. 1: cmd bus has 1 extra cycle of latency 0: default This port is available only when MEMP_CMD_PIPELINE is defined.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_CLK_STALL_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: This port determines whether delay line clock stalls at HIGH or LOW level. The expected input is a very slow clock to avoid asymmetric aging in delay lines. This port is implementation specific and may not be available in all PHYs.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_BL2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Burst length control. 1: burst length 2 0: other burst length

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_LPDDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: If the PHY is operating in LPDDR Mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_DIS_PHY_CTRL_RSTN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disable the PHY Control Macro reset. 1: PHY Control macro doesn't get reset. 0: PHY Control macro gets reset. (default)

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_WRLVL_INC_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Incremental Write Leveling Mode. One bit for each data slice. 1: incremental write leveling. 0: normal write leveling.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REG_PHY_GATELVL_INC_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Incremental Read DQS Gate Training Mode. One bit for each data slice. 1: incremental Read Gate training. 0: normal Read Gate training.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_RESET
spirit:field.spirit:description: A 1 in this register will bring the PHY out of Reset. This is dynamic and synchronized internally before giving to PHY.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_NBRWB_SIZE_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_NUBF_SZ
spirit:field.spirit:description: This signal indicates the size of non bufferable address region. The region sizes are as follows: 0000: Reserved (default) 0001: 64KB bufferable region 0010: 128KB bufferable region 0011: 256KB bufferable region 0100: 512KB bufferable region 0101: 1MB bufferable region 0110: 2MB bufferable region 0111: 4MB bufferable region 1000: 8MB bufferable region 1001: 16MB bufferable region 1010: 32MB bufferable region 1011: 64MB bufferable region 1100: 128MB bufferable region 1101: 256MB bufferable region 1110: 512MB bufferable region 1111: 1GB bufferable region

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_WCB_SZ
spirit:field.spirit:description: Configures write buffer and read buffer size as per DDR burst size. This port is common for all buffers. Buffers can be configured to 16 byte or 32 byte size. 0b: buffer size is configured to 16 byte 1b: buffer size is configured to 32 byte

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the size of non bufferable address region.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_TIMER
spirit:field.spirit:description: 10 bit timer interface used to configure time out register. Once timer reaches to time out value, flush request is generated by flush controller in DDR_FIC. This port is common for all buffers.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_flshM1
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1: Flush read buffer for AHB lite master1. 0: Default.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_4
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Invalidates write buffer and read buffer for AHB lite master1 and master2.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_SW_WR_ERCLR_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_M1_WR_ERCLR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Clear bit for error status posted by AHB lite master1 write buffer. Once it goes high, error status is cleared.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_M2_WR_ERCLR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Clear bit for error status of AHB lite master2 write buffer. Once it goes high, error status is cleared.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_LTO_CLR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Clear signal to lock time out interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Clear bit for error status by AHB lite master1 and master2 write buffer.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_ERR_INT_ENABLE_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: SYR_HPD_WR_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Status bit. Goes high when error response is received for bufferable write request. Goes low when processor serves the interrupt when the SYR_HPD_WR_ERR bit goes high and makes clear bit for AHB lite master2 high.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SYR_SW_WR_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Status bit. Goes high when error response is received for bufferable write request. Goes low when processor serves interrupt and makes clear bit for AHB lite master1

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Used for Interrupt generation.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_NUM_AHB_MASTERS_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_NUM_AHB_MASTERS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Defines whether one or two AHB lite 32 bit Master's are implemented in fabric. 0: One 32 bit AHB Master implemented in fabric 1: Two 32 bit AHB Master's implemented in fabric.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_M1_ERR_ADD
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 16 bits Tag of write buffer for which error response is received is placed in this register. Following values are updated in this register as per buffer size, For 16 bits Buffer size DDR_FIC_M1_ERR_ADD[31:0] is (TAG, 0000) and for 32 bits Buffer size DDR_FIC_M1_ERR_ADD[31:0] is (TAG[27:1], 00000)

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_M2_WBEMPTY
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1: Write buffer of AHB lite master2 is not having valid data. 0: Default.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_3
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_M1_RDSBL_DN
spirit:field.spirit:description: High indicates AHB lite master1 write buffer is disabled.

spirit:field.spirit:description: High indicates AHB lite master1 read buffer is disabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_M2_RDSBL_DN
spirit:field.spirit:description: High indicates AHB lite master2 read buffer is disabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_M2_WDSBL_DN

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_LCKTOUT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates lock counter in arbiter reached to its maximum value. Lock counter (20-bit) starts counting when a locked request got access to bus and will be cleared when lock signal becomes logic 0.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DDR_FIC_LOCK_TIMEOUTVAL_1_CR

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGR_LOCK_TIMEOUT_REG
spirit:field.spirit:description: Lower 16 bits. Lock time out 20 bit register. Indicates maximum number of cycles a master can hold the bus for locked transfer. If master hold the bus for locked transfer more than the required cycles, an interrupt is generated.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: Reserved
spirit:field.spirit:description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
